intro: Couratari lecythopsis, commonly known as the red-barked tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lecythidaceae. It is native to the Amazon rainforest, primarily found in Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its smooth, reddish-brown bark that peels in thin layers. Its leaves are alternate, elliptical, and have a glossy upper surface. Couratari lecythopsis produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by woody capsules containing numerous seeds.
